revised_title: Incorporation of PbS into Non-Stoichiometric Sb2S3 Phases: Structure and Defects
tldr: The authors investigate the structure of non-stoichiometric phases in the Sb2S3-PbS system close to Sb2S3 using high-resolution electron microscopy. They find that chains of SbS5 groups in Sb2S3 crystals are lengthened by incorporating PbS, forming new structures related to cannizzarite and galena. These structures can be ordered or disordered, creating homologous series of phases or operationally non-stoichiometric phases.
